If you had to pick an answer, I'd say **(B) Yes**, Japanese serfdom had a higher status than its English counterpart.

The US joined the Allies in 1917 for a couple of key reasons.  First, Germany started sinking American ships in the North Atlantic without warning. This was called unrestricted submarine warfare, and it really angered the American people.  

Second, Germany sent a secret message to Mexico, trying to get them to attack the US. This message, called the Zimmerman Telegram, was intercepted and made public, which made Americans even more upset with Germany. 

So, the two main reasons were unrestricted submarine warfare and the Zimmerman Telegram.
